keyword: how many calories in a fried egg
title: How Many Calories in a Fried Egg?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a fried egg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Fried Egg?
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), fried in 1 tsp vegetable oil, no added salt; sunny-side up style.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, frying fat type/amount, cooking time, and added seasonings. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A large fried egg provides ~92 kcal and ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in butter (1 tsp instead of oil)
Add 1 slice American cheese on top

faqs.q: How many calories in a fried egg?
faqs.a: About 92 kcal for one large fried egg with 1 tsp oil.

faqs.q: Is a fried egg higher in calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, frying adds ~40 kcal from oil; boiled is ~78 kcal.

faqs.q: What are the macros for a fried egg?
faqs.a: ≈6.3 g protein, 7 g fat, 0.4 g carbs.

faqs.q: Does frying method affect calories in a fried egg?
faqs.a: Yes—more oil or butter increases fat and calories; non-stick reduces them.

faqs.q: How much cholesterol in a fried egg?
faqs.a: About 185 mg, mostly from the yolk; frying doesn't change it much.
